website_summaries.verdict: JLab's Go Air earphones are far from the best true wireless earbuds you'll find, but at $30 they're the most affordable.
cons: Touch-sensitive controls are hard to operate

customer_reviews.title: Good earbuds, but pay the extra for the Epic Air.
customer_reviews.text: This is my 3rd pair of JLad headphones, I love their stuff usually. They sound great, that's what keeps me coming back. The case looks cool, but the earbuds fall out and I'm worried about losing one. Also, I don't like not having a button to push, the touch is overly sensitive. I would recommend getting the Air Epics over the Air Go, it's worth the extra money.
customer_reviews.author: Drew

customer_reviews.title: Not for small ears
customer_reviews.text: Sound is good but definitely not for little ears! Maybe I just have abnormally small ears but they fall out after a short time. I bend down, they fall out, I smile, they fall out. Yawn they fall out. Just look elsewhere if you wonder about fit.
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: These buds are excellent !!
customer_reviews.text: They do everything Jlabs says they do. They are small & light, pair instantly, have a built in charging cable, touch activated controls including volume - w/ 3 EQ settings, sound great, fit in your pocket & they stay in your ears !!
customer_reviews.author: My Stuff

customer_reviews.title: not bad at all.
customer_reviews.text: I had never heard of this brand before my nephew told me about them. They sound really good. Great bass and clarity. I wish they would go a little louder though. They do start hurting my ear after a few hours of use. Otherwise they would get a 5 star review. I recommend to anyone on a budget. Edit... So I realized that I was wearing them wrong in my ear. The issue with discomfort has been resolved. They are louder now. Original post was 4/5 stars but now I'm going with 5/5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: A best cheap solution for wireless listener
customer_reviews.text: The earbuds are exception good at $30, you can buy a cost more earbuds, but why? sound reasonably good, IP44, small enough to take with you anywhere, 4 hours + additional charge on it case, especially the cable build-in. I'm happy with it, so what it's don't have fancy noise reduction.... for the price, I wish it have all the colors so I can have diff. one at diff. days. Xman.
customer_reviews.author: Xuyen Hinh

customer_reviews.title: Missing ear fittings
customer_reviews.text: Like the product spund is great and they do the job for me at my job im in and out of wharehouse all day and these guys work great the only bad thing i can say are the ear fitting pieces i dint receive a full i was missing the smallest ear fitting and those are the ones i use it was a quick fix i took the fitting from and old set of skull candy earphones and put them on other then that minor disappointment im pretty happy with the buy
customer_reviews.author: yunior Sanchez

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: I really like these except I was they would go LOUDER! They cut off at a certain level and for old rockers like me I want more power! The bass EQ is cool, but again, wish they would go louder! I then purchased 2 more pair as my sons liked them when I got mine and I used them as motivation for them to get all A's and B's on their final report card, which they accomplished! Price is great and the product is awesome!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Must Buy
customer_reviews.text: Honestly they sound better and even connect better then my original first generation airpods. The rubber tips help block out background noise very well which i why i bought these. The touch controls cabe a bit frustrating to get used to but the function fine. Honestly cant believe that truly wireless earbuds have come so far that they are only $30 and sound/work better than my airpods which originally cost $160. Im usually a big supporter of apple but JLab has apple beat on the regular airpods and even the airpod pros possibly. Already recommended these to several friends
customer_reviews.author: Dannylands

customer_reviews.title: Extremely disappointed
customer_reviews.text: These came two days earlier than expected and packaging was good. The headphones however are not. The good: These are cute visually Arrived Early Packaged Well Comes with 3 free months of Tidal The bad: The fit isn’t good with any of the ear bud protectors No wall plug The Ugly: These are not loud and I even tried all three audio versions. They fell out of my ears right away. Not worth the price. I have only had them an hour. I was so excited to get these. I feel really disappointed that these are not what I felt was described in their ad.
customer_reviews.author: RealCriticReviews

customer_reviews.title: not loud at all!!
customer_reviews.text: don't understand the 5 star reviews.......this heaset is not loud at all. if you want to hear the bass of the sound you listening too you have to raise the volume to 90% most of my other heasets once you reach 50 60 high you good to go. its a waste of money but i guess those 5 stars review only like noise in their head instead of good sounding music at mid heights. Also the charger is so so short that you need an extension cord to charge it. Worst waste of money headset i have ever gotten
customer_reviews.author: Andre Ferguson

customer_reviews.title: Good...until it wasn't
customer_reviews.text: I got these at the end of May after a lot of research. They worked great. The ear pieces were too big for my ears, but I got used to it after a week. I figured the size helps cancel noise (which it did). They stayed put while working out, too (except for a few times during inversions). The bluetooth pairing is easy. But now it's July, and after exactly 2 months of use, and one of the ear buds stopped holding charge. It's disappointing; I could have spent a little more and gotten better quality ones. That's my review.
customer_reviews.author: Nikki

customer_reviews.title: Great fit and great sound. Awesome price.
customer_reviews.text: First time buying earbuds. They fit really nice and they dont fall out. Sound is alot better than I was expecting. Very impressed so far.
customer_reviews.author: Ryank33

customer_reviews.title: Controls could be better
customer_reviews.text: The price cannot be beat. The controls are messy. You can only pause with the right headphone. If you are like me and usually only have one in your ear at a time, for podcasts, etc, then that means you cannot pause your audio if you are wearing the left. Same with Siri. That is only controlled with the left earbud. You cannot use the right to activate your assistant. Seems like an odd decision to make, considering every knock-off earbud set allows you to do both of those things from both buds.
customer_reviews.author: AlpineScott

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money I paid for
customer_reviews.text: At medium settings for volume the volume is at its lowest. Even my current wireless headphone that I've had for about a year is louder than these brand new ones. I've only charged this a couple of times over a day and the battery life did not last over 6 hrs.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron James

customer_reviews.title: Sound is great!
customer_reviews.text: I love the earbuds, but they keep falling out of my ears. I've changed the different earbuds from small, medium to large and they still fall of my ears. Trying to pair them has not made them user-friendly either, but I really like them. I'm going to have to purchase a different set of wireless earbuds, but I am definitely staying with the JLab.
customer_reviews.author: Eyreal Shaw

customer_reviews.title: Ideal for low impact sports - OK battery life
customer_reviews.text: I run 10K-half marathons on average on weekends, I got these so that I could comfortably wear sunglasses without headphone intrusion. They kept wanting to fall out and had to continuously readjust and resecure (yes I've tried the different size tips). As for battery life, about 1.5 hours into my run, it does a fade out every couple seconds like it's telling me the battery is low.. incredibly annoying as I listen to books on my runs. But they look good and aren't too uncomfortable when they are staying in and working. Sound level is a bit low at max volume if outside.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Melendez

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it.
customer_reviews.text: To be frank these effing suck. I would literally rather listen to silence during my work outs then use these POS. First, the fit is awkward definitely not comfortable. Forget even thinking about wearing these if your going to actually be sweating a lot because they will slide right out of your ears and you have to keep readjusting constantly. You can’t connect to multiple devices at once, so if I were to use these out on a run I have to go back inside and disconnect from my peloton. I’ve only had these for a short while and now only one headphone works.
customer_reviews.author: Alexandria

customer_reviews.title: Sound skips constantly!! Very Irritating
customer_reviews.text: I'm not gonna bother returning simply because I am following stay at home orders and have a weak immune system but if there were no pandemic I definitely would return these and get my money back. Music doesn't play with the actual sound and sound skips like every three seconds. Incredibly annoying. If you're doing online meetings, these stop playing all sound even while still being connected. I thought my professor was having trouble with his mic. Turns out these crappy earbuds just weren't working properly. Never again.
customer_reviews.author: Jocylene Arevalo

customer_reviews.title: Tinny sound, poor construction, terrible quality
customer_reviews.text: I can’t imagine a more deceptive description for a more poorly made product. The sound quality is atrocious and the tinny sound exemplifies its poor construction. Forget about running with these; they fell out less than two minutes after inserting into my ears and sitting on the couch. I’m really disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Poor Bass Response and Volume
customer_reviews.text: I bought these jlab jbud air GO earbuds as a replacement for the jlab jbuds AIR after the button membrane came loose. What impressed me about the jbuds air was the complete system: excellent bass, good comfortable fit, and what a GREAT idea to integrate the cable into the charging/carrying box for less tiny items to carry. So,I got these air Go 20% smaller for roughly half the price. That price should have warned me. These earbuds have lower max volume and much less bass response than the jbuds Air. The 20% smaller size gives MUCH LESS sound quality. So I don't recommend the kbuds Air Go for music. They sound clear enough for other uses though.
customer_reviews.author: fred paddock

customer_reviews.title: Easy sync. Great sound!
customer_reviews.text: I've been using these for a couple of weeks now. Great sound quality. I had a cheap pair of Ear Pod knock offs. They wouldn't pair automatically. The sound never synced up either. The JLabs pair instantly and give true stereo sound. They also sync to video which I have seen and heard others don't. I just have to get used to carrying the case. I've used around the neck headphones for years.
customer_reviews.author: Staceyw

customer_reviews.title: Poor Battery Life and charging mechanism
customer_reviews.text: These aren't the worst earbuds I have ever used, but the battery life and the charge cord are not great. The battery life is listed as roughly 6 hours of continuous use on a full charge, but I get roughly 2 per full charge. The usb cable for charging is affixed to the case itself and is only 2 inches in length. The earbuds sound quality and noise cancelling effects are pretty decent, but it's not worth the purchase unless you are trying to find something of equivalence and prefer really cheap or inexpensive options. I will continue to my corded headphones. I get better sound quality and can use them for much longer more comfortably
customer_reviews.author: Rosendo

customer_reviews.title: so close to great, but no
customer_reviews.text: out of the box they are well set up they pair quickly and easily, you get 3 sizes of ear bud things for them so small medium and large I suppose the "controls" are touch, no haptive feedback nothing just have to hope you touch the correct spot not in the slightest are these ever going to be called too loud, they lack the power to deliver anything other than maybe church sermons and hymns I would rather have cords wrapped around me then use these they are that quiet. yes I did take the time to RTFM, I understand one tap on the right is up volume and left one tape is down, and they still suck
customer_reviews.author: dave9969

customer_reviews.title: Convenient, long battery life, and great for calls.
customer_reviews.text: I have the army green color. I like them! The quality is better than the price paid, so it was worth the buy. Making calls are easy and the earphones connect easily and work at a good distance. I rated four stars because of the excess noise heard in my background stated by other callers. The mic seems to be sensitive. It holds true to the other caller being able to hear me clearly, which is mainly why I bought this product. The ear inserts came with three different sizes (S, M, L). It’s compact and holds charge for hours and is comfortable in the ear.
customer_reviews.author: Kaylin Riggs

customer_reviews.title: So far so good.
customer_reviews.text: Considering the price, these might be 5 star. Sound quality is decent. Of the 3 EQ modes, only Bass Boost sounds good to me. The other too are really tinny or too flat. As with most wireless headphones, they don't get nearly as loud as I like. It took a minute to realize that was ok with these, because they block out ambient noise. Comfort wise, these are good. Once you get them positioned correctly, they are secure and the sound quality gets better as they sit and expand. Convenience wise, these are great. The case gets charged and the case charges the buds. Pretty neat. For $30 I'm very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan H.

customer_reviews.title: This item does not connect or disconnect right, charging problems etc..
customer_reviews.text: If you have any other blue tooth devices connected to your phone (smartwatch for example) there is a constant disruption between the two devices. The earpieces don't charge correctly and can hardly be heard by the other caller on a phone call. Just for a reference on the devices I use to connect to these JLAB Airs are a Galaxy S10 plus, iPhone 10S, and an HP Pavilion, so everything I use is relatively new and the problem consists across all of the electronics.
customer_reviews.author: J.Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Not bad for $30
customer_reviews.text: These are definitely good for the $30 price tag. Do they sound as good as the $100 TWS earbuds? No definitely not, but there's a reason the others are much more expensive. I bought these while I wait for my Cambridge Audio melomania 1s to be repaired and will be keeping them as a back up once I have the other pair back. Pro tip: put them on the JLAB signature sound eq. The other 2 are garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff b.

customer_reviews.title: One big flaw - no lid on case
customer_reviews.text: The buds snap magnetically into the case. But there is no lid to hold them there. In my experience, when carrying them around, they would keep on popping out of the case enough to pair with my phone and run down their battery. Also if the case were dropped on the floor, or the buds could pop out. Finally, I found the case too big to carry comfortably in a pants pocket.
customer_reviews.author: M. Maynard

customer_reviews.title: loses connectivity
customer_reviews.text: So I carry my phone at chest level and when I turn my head the earbuds loose connectivity and keep cutting out. It's not long but enough to be annoying. The left earbud will cut in and out intermittently and is just as annoying. I am using a Galaxy S8 with these. That being said they do have good sound and the price is right, they stayed in my ears but the function buttons were finicky with larger fingers. I really wished they would have work but they are being returned and I will try a different model since others I have had were flawless.
customer_reviews.author: Mark w

customer_reviews.title: Good sound on a budget
customer_reviews.text: For the price, these earbuds have good sound quality, connect very fast and are surprisingly comfortable. The noise cancelling is decent and I get a solid 5hours from each earbud plus the charging case works great. For reference, I listen to music and audiobooks through headphones for around 8-10 hours a day and wanted to ditch the over the ear style for the summer and break into the true wireless without spending much $. They also aren't a big loss if I drop one while kayaking. If you want solid, true wireless earbuds that sound good and you can't afford the big name offerings, you won't regret getting a pair of these.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Better not best
customer_reviews.text: I took back my review this is a final review for these but 3/5. I just bought the new samsung Galaxy s20fe which does not have a headphone port. I paid about $40 total for these and the jlab cloud foam earbud replacement ear pieces to help close out some more sound. It made these fair sounding they're definitely not the loudest but clear, charge is decent as well. Price overall I'd say they're worth the buy for sure and the warranty is great my first pair was defective they over nighted me a replacement pair. Definitely stick to jlab for headphones going forward.
customer_reviews.author: Nickolas Keith McClanahan

customer_reviews.title: Good value.
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my wife so I haven’t tried them too long. She had some dropping out at first. We disconnected them from her phone, reconnected them to each other and then to the phone and they have been fine since. You must be careful when inserting them in the charging case as they don’t always connect to the charger. For a low dollar set of earbuds they are well worth the money. Don’t expect perfect sound quality they lack a bit of bass and are a little bit trebley. But overall tolerable. Work well with calls and the touch controls are pretty good.
customer_reviews.author: Ken Beitler

customer_reviews.title: Connection issues and poor voice quality
customer_reviews.text: My main complaint about this item is the poor connectivity. They don't stay connected for phone calls - I have to reconnect whenever I make a call (not good when you're driving). Sometimes one side will connect, but the other won't. People I talk to complain about the sound quality (too much background noise, poor voice quality). I also have a problem with the things stopping or inadvertently stopping if I happen to touch them while listening. The sound quality isn't bad, but my old Apple earbuds are better. Overall, they just don't perform very well - I guess you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Knisely

customer_reviews.title: Pleasantly Surprised!
customer_reviews.text: The battery life last surpringly long. I've used these a few hours a day and very surprised how scarecely I have to charge them. I especially love how they work independently of each other. The one drawback is the touch function on the buds, with no buttons, but it's definitely not a deal breaker. I love that you can just take one out of the case and it syncs immediately to my phone. I don't know how I ever lived without these. They have not fallen out while I have lifted weights or rode a stationary bike, but I have not tried running with them and don't think I would try it.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsey Os

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy
customer_reviews.text: I had high expectations for these after reading some reviews. My right earbud randomly disconnects from Bluetooth. Sound is mediocre at best the ear pieces are way too big, even with the small size they end up uncomfortable after a short time of use. Update- 7/7/20, Now after charging them 4 times, they no longer turn on. Don't waste your time with this garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Brianna Turnbom

customer_reviews.title: Sound good but very unreliable
customer_reviews.text: They would be perfect if you could rely on them to work every single time. In my experience, and I have read many forums stating the same, the Left earbud OFTEN stops working. It's a glitch or something. The only way to get it to work again is to let the battery run completely down, then it will reset and work again for a while. You may get 25 uses or 3 before it happens again. Very frustration. However, the Right one seems to always work, so if you're just using one for calls or podcasts, it works great.
customer_reviews.author: Jodi Jolly

customer_reviews.title: Not ideal for awareness, not the loudest, but extremely lifestyle-friendly
customer_reviews.text: Bluetooth controls and long battery life makes this a safe entry point for wireless earbuds. Ideal for someone's first wireless bus, since the risks are mitigated by the low cost. Water durability remains to be seen, but the lidless charging case and low cost tells me you have to expect these not to last long, relatively speaking. The volume seems lackluster, I rarely dip below maximum volume — but the fit in my ear dampens noise almost too well, I can hardly hear people speaking near me without pausing the audio altogether.
customer_reviews.author: Anneliese

customer_reviews.title: Okay earbuds
customer_reviews.text: While I never pan a product, and agree to keep this one, the sound quality is very low. Maybe I should just say the volume is very low not sure that the sound quality would be better if I could hear better. 99% of this problem is I'm hearing impaired. But I ordered lots hearing type products. Earbuds headphones Bluetooth speakers striving to find one that gives me the right volume in the quality of sound that old guy with hearing loss needs. Unfortunately this one is a swing in the miss given these to the kids are keep on trying
customer_reviews.author: Pastor J. Dan Renfro D.D.

customer_reviews.title: PSA: I'm dumb
customer_reviews.text: Originally I had given this product one star because it stopped charging after only 40 days of use. The problem was, I'm dumb. The earbuds are happily charging as I write this, now that the left and right pieces are in their respective slots. The sound quality is good. The noise cancellation is decent, holding its own against factory white noise. Getting them to sit right without falling out takes a bit of fiddling, but they hold comfortably enough. Just make sure they go back in the right ports when you're done!
customer_reviews.author: Stephen

customer_reviews.title: Worth 29.99$
customer_reviews.text: I have used these half a dozen times to make and answer calls. I typically use one ear for calls and it works pretty good. The bud stays in my ear and only gets uncomfortable after maybe 90 mins. I do have trouble when trying to connect it to my phone sometimes. It causes the phone screen to flash in and out. However, that has only happened when a call has not been answered and I try to pair them. These look great, feel good, and have quality sound. Grab yourself a set at 29.99$, you can't beat That price!
customer_reviews.author: S. Plissken

customer_reviews.title: So far... love them... will update as I use them
customer_reviews.text: Well easy to charge with charging cord that tucks neatly into the device.... Won’t loose it and makes it easy to carry in your pocket otherwise... Sound is amazing.... Battery life seems great so far... yes you can use one at a time... which is a win win.... pairs easily with my iPhone 10 and I watch 3.... price point was great as well at only $32.00... Sits well in your ear, like that nothing dangles from your ear.... to get caught on anything.... hope this helps....😊
customer_reviews.author: Klra22

customer_reviews.title: Extra earbuds not in box!!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these for my son's 8th birthday. They are just right for him. My only issue is they didn't come with the extra earbuds to adjust the fit in his ear. He's 8,the only one that was sent with it are too big so they keep slipping out so now I have to buy something that was already supposed to come with it. Literally all earbuds come with different sizes. I also see in the reviews I'm not the only one that didn't receive them. That's false advertisement because they are stated to be included.
customer_reviews.author: Lavonne

customer_reviews.title: Right bud stopped working after a month.
customer_reviews.text: Got these for my brother. He seemed to enjoy them. The sound quality was fine for the price for sure. The case was nice, battery life was okay. But after a month the right earbud stopped functioning completely. Won't charge, won't turn on, won't produce any sound. Just dead. This is the reason I stopped using other Bluetooth earbuds before. Honestly would recommend saving some money and buying a better pair that will last.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Battery life sucks
customer_reviews.text: I've used other JLAB headphones, and they worked pretty well for at least a few months - until the battery would not work as well. However, from the very beginning of when I used them, after I charged these fully, it only charged the buds at medium. I tried several times to charge them fully, but they would only charge to medium, and now they won't charge at all. In addition, they did not sync as easily with my watch or phone as easily as the other ones. Don't waste your money on these more low quality earbuds.
customer_reviews.author: JT

customer_reviews.title: Great product design!
customer_reviews.text: I like it! The design is simple yet cool. Love the military green. The build in charging cable makes the problem of cords non existent. The magnetic charging slots for the ear peace’s makes storing very easy. The buttonless touch control is cool. Oh boy complaint is the sound. Although good, it could be louder. Especially for quite videos. Having cauliflower ear, it actually doesn’t fall out when I run. Normal blue tooth designs normally do. NICE!
customer_reviews.author: Marco G. Lara

customer_reviews.title: Sound quality is really bad.
customer_reviews.text: I'm really sensitive to the sound and this earbuds reminded me of my very first 5 dollar wired earbuds. The best description will be it sounds like a toy if that makes sense. The touch button is very unpredictable. Very annoying. I'm just going to stick to traditional wired headphones. Maybe I wound keep it if there were like 15 bucks. I'm sorry but people who say it worth more than 30 bucks don't care about sound quality at all or just deaf.
customer_reviews.author: Sun kyu, Choi

customer_reviews.title: Worth $30. We’ll see
customer_reviews.text: Likes and dislikes I take them everywhere with me , if they get lost or damaged , no worries they are inexpensive Sound quality is on par with the price , they don’t get loud but they do block out sound fairly well , battery life is good I have run out of juice only a few times Comfortable to wear in bed , I have fallen asleep with them in. Hard to go wrong with the $30 My return date was oct 12 and it’s now oct 27 and starting to having connections issues as many have stated So we will see how well the support is ???
customer_reviews.author: Hung solo

customer_reviews.title: Small ear canals might look elsewhere
customer_reviews.text: Not for small ear canals. The only brand that has ever worked well for me in that department is Plantronics Backbeat Fit, everything else hurts or falls out, these are no different. The sound quality it medium to good (not great), calls cant be heard. Even music has a gradient sound to it, going up and down. I had high hopes for these, my kids like JLabs Audio Pro wireless headset and those seem to last them longer so I hoped these would be good too.
customer_reviews.author: Sasha Patton

customer_reviews.title: Not so great for me
customer_reviews.text: Definitely not for small ear canals. These suckers will fall out if not cramped in your ears tightly. Not the greatest in comfort and sound quality is that to my cheap Walmart wired earbuds. And don't even think about running with these on. They will fall out.
customer_reviews.author: W

customer_reviews.title: They're ok
customer_reviews.text: These are ok. I had to order a replacement because the right earbud quit working within 4 hours of receiving them. I havent had any issues with the second pair. I wish they fit better in my ear, I think the sound quality would be better with a proper fit. I love the color and the charging case, although i would prefer a closed case. My toddler did fill the case (without the earbuds) with milk and it survived so 10/10 on durability for the case haha.
customer_reviews.author: Ashlyn moss

customer_reviews.title: Individual use = more listening
customer_reviews.text: I had another pair of these that were twice the price and misplaced them so thought I would try these. What I LOVE about this set is that you can use each ear plug on its own. If you only use one then that leaves you with twice the listening time. The battery life is great. I used one for over 6 hours straight. The down side is the case it comes in doesn't have a lid so when it is in your pockets it can get lint and such inside.
customer_reviews.author: Bavarianbear

customer_reviews.title: Great sound quality and fit, be wary of battery life
customer_reviews.text: Sound quality is good for the price and size of ear buds. I appreciate the EQ options built in. The fit is great. I have never had ear buds that have actually stayed in my ears before! My only complaint here is the battery life--the charging case helps, but the earbuds do seem to die a little faster than most bluetooth headphones. It is fine for a regular commute, and will definitely charge when you put them back in the case, but for extended use such as long road trips or several hours of use.... they die too fast for my extended use.
customer_reviews.author: Ted

customer_reviews.title: Won’t connect to each other
customer_reviews.text: These are trash. The left one will not connect to the right, so I get sound out of 1 earbud. I looked up how to reset them, and was successful l, and got them both to pair. Problem is, when I put them in the charger, the left one disconnects from the right, and I have to go through the process of resetting them again. I didn’t expect amazing quality for the price, but these are useless unless you want to only listen to music in 1 ear.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron F.

customer_reviews.title: Get what you pay for...
customer_reviews.text: First off instead of a conventional micro usb or usb c connection, the charging case has a 3” full-size male usb cable. So the case would most likely inconveniently hang from a wall socket connected to your charging plug. Really? Some companies are just too extra. Sound quality is decent as long you’re listening to music, books, podcasts... in a soundproof closet on a deserted island. They are very low.
customer_reviews.author: Duke Pine

customer_reviews.title: Decent earbuds for the price. Just not loud enough.
customer_reviews.text: Overall good balanced sound with imperceptible low distortion. Problem is they just are not very loud, especially for streaming video, YouTube, etc. I’ve got a set for me and my daughter and she has the same complaint. That said battery life is excellent and I like that you can use either bud for single "phone call/conference call use." In fact that is very useful for driving. Very comfortable and stays in place.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel P.

customer_reviews.title: Bargain Performance and Practicality
customer_reviews.text: As an audiophile, I was impressed by the sound quality for the price. These came highly recommended by several website reviews, and I was not disappointed. I then purchased two more as gifts. Good comfort and fit, portability, charge duration for the buds and the case, sound isolation, and sweat tolerance. I wear these for CrossFit and running and they never fall out or malfunction. Very impressed!
customer_reviews.author: MichiganJayhawk

customer_reviews.title: Great ear buds!!
customer_reviews.text: These are pretty dang cool wireless ear buds. For the price, they work really well! My almost 18 y/o son works out in them (cardio, boxing & weight lifting) and they don't fall or pop out of his ears. The battery life could be better (about 5 hrs). Again, for the price it's expected. They are in my opinion a little bigger than I'd like, but the sound is amazing. Well worth what we paid.
customer_reviews.author: Cwissy

customer_reviews.title: Good Product except for noise cancellation.
customer_reviews.text: These earbuds seemed to work well. I did not test to see if the battery lasted as advertised because I returned them to Amazon. The reason I returned them is the did not provide enough volume or did not block enough external noise to work for me. I use them for walking on a moderately busy roadway and while mowing my lawn and could not get enough volume to hear what I was listening to.
customer_reviews.author: JMM

customer_reviews.title: great sound and price, but I personally don't like the rubber piece in my ear hole.
customer_reviews.text: Borrowed a pair from my roommate, and the quality was great. I'm not a fan of the rubber part in my ears, but it got me through my graveyard shift. THEN IT FELL. A plastic piece came off exposing the circuitry of one of the earpieces and that covering promptly disappeared under large kitchen machinery and counter tops and I couldn't find it. Feeling bad for damaging something that wasn't mine, I bought my roommate another set, hence my purchase via Amazon, and she loves them a lot. Overall good and not some swindling hack's idea of a counterfeit product. Worth the purchase, but heaven help you if you drop it and break it.
customer_reviews.author: marty

customer_reviews.title: Good for everyday use -you get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: For 39 bucks these are really good for everyday use. Sound quality is good and the eq functions are ok. I use the “mowing the lawn test” to see how well the seal outside noise and how well they sound. They do not block outside noise well, but if you use the right ear pieces and rotate them for fit, they will work well outside of the mowing test. If your relaxing on the beach or lounge chair they are just fine. If you want better noise reduction and a more crisp sound, spend a little more and get active noise canceling ear buds. Good for general listening .
customer_reviews.author: Michael D.

customer_reviews.title: Good buds. But could be great if it had more volume.
customer_reviews.text: Sound great, nice having the 3 EQ settings, but as others have mentioned the volume is nothing near what it could be. I used them for a few days, listening mostly to podcasts, but also used them also for music and calls. Sound quality is good, as is battery life, but i ended up giving them to my S/O cause of the volume. I may try JLabs next line above this one for $50. Until then I'll still use my Chinese Wish buds.
customer_reviews.author: Raymond Mccloud

customer_reviews.title: Broke a week in but warranty is good so keep printed purchase info
customer_reviews.text: They were good for when I had them until the left ear just stopped working completely and I didn't know why. It was good I kept the purchasing info and so I sent them back and got back twice than what I originally paid for so I was able to buy the newer model anyway. So make sure to keep the information that it comes with so that if they do break you can get befits. Overall the company and product are good. This model, in particular, broke too fast for my liking but as I've said the 2-year warranty is good so it doesn't bother me too much
customer_reviews.author: Lauryn

customer_reviews.title: Not perfect, but 1000% more value than what I payed for.
customer_reviews.text: Works exactly as it purports to. Super happy. Problems: The microphone for phone calls sorta sucks, and is super sensitive to wind or surrounding noise. Still... I'd pay more for these than what was charged. Tip: If you want super awesome sound, buy some memory foam earbud tips. This gives super awesome noise cancelation, and way, way more bass & clarity. I use these...
customer_reviews.author: Jennie Harward

customer_reviews.title: Mobility issue
customer_reviews.text: Overall, I like them. However, I thought I was supposed to be able to get 30', or there about, away from my phone with them. This is important because I'm a walker and talker, and I can only get a dozen or so feet away before I start having connection problems. It's not a horrible thing, just different from what the description said. I just have to remember to put my phone in my pocket, when I start getting mobile.
customer_reviews.author: Pastor Sheldon

customer_reviews.title: Good for a 1st pair of Bluetooth earbuds.
customer_reviews.text: I use these earbuds on a Google Pixel 3. Likes: - Noise cancelation - Sound quality - Price - Ease of use - Dual connect Dislikes: - Battery life - Fit & Comfort - No actual buttons This is my first pair of Bluetooth earbuds. For me the battery life lasts about 3.5 hours of continuous use, and to charge back to 100% takes about an hour. The touch controls are more like tap controls which hurt your ears. For a first pair of Bluetooth earbuds they are good for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler

customer_reviews.title: Not meant for small ears.
customer_reviews.text: I expected battery life to be longer, fully charged i got about 7-8 hrs of usage before needing to recharge. My main complaint is I feel they are to bulky and even with the smallest cushion didn't fit in my ear nor did they stay without falling. Maybe for someone else they'd fit perfect but not small ears. Other than that I do like them wish I could get more use out of them. The sound quality is good as well as noise cancellation.
customer_reviews.author: Jconcept

customer_reviews.title: died after three months
customer_reviews.text: These did not fit my ears well, when I could get them to stay in, the sound was fine, nothing special. They no longer charged after three months of sporadic use. A waste of money in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel b

customer_reviews.title: Great inexpensive wireless headphones!
customer_reviews.text: I wanted some wireless headphones without spending a ton of money and these work great! I use them mostly for phone calls and they’re very comfortable even for longer periods of time. As far as sound quality they’re OK for music but pretty bass heavy. If I wanted these only for music I’d probably be a little disappointed. For taking calls and sitting through long zoom meetings they’re perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel E Carberry

customer_reviews.title: Fit well, easy to use, output is very quiet though
customer_reviews.text: Very low volume. The only thing I don’t like about these is the output is extremely low, luckily I am just wearing one while at work and not listening too loudly. They fit great and are easy to use and connect and sound isn’t bad for the price however I could see how trying to use these when background noise is loud like cutting the grass or working out etc not working too well
customer_reviews.author: Chris s

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: You're not going to get super loud amazing quality but you do get a pair of reliable, good sounding with nice features. Biggest drawback is volume is too low. I still think they are a great purchase and got a replacement for my girlfriend who left her AirPods out of town at a family members house. Her biggest complaint is volume is too low.
customer_reviews.author: Seth

customer_reviews.title: Horrible Sound Quality!
customer_reviews.text: Although they are very comfortable to wear and the battery life is amazing, I can only give 3 stars because the sound quality is HORRIBLE!! They are so low I can barely hear my music even after adjusting the bass and volume at the highest level it can go. I can buy a pair of cheaper wireless pods and the sound quality is so much better. Definitely do not recommend if you’re looking for quality sound.. 😒
customer_reviews.author: Robyn B

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality, even considering the price. Look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.text: Pros -Sound is about what you'd expect for the price -The plastic is very durable Cons -Bluetooth keeps cutting off, and it's very annoying -The battery takes forever to charge -Customer service is terrible - they've straight up ignored my support ticket for a week -The JLab logo on the ear tips protrude, and it's very rough on the ears -The built in "charging cable" is very short and janky, so you pretty much need to use a power bank or else just leave it dangling on the wall -Tap controls are shoddy at best and you're better off using your phone -Charging case is too thick to put in your pocket without it bulging out awkwardly
customer_reviews.author: Jun

customer_reviews.title: Extended battery life with charging case!
customer_reviews.text: These JLab headphones are affordable and have good sound quality. I love the fact that I can charge them on the go with the case, that's a big help. I ended up buying another pair for work. I recommend these headphones as they work well and are affordable. The only con is that it's hard to learn and use the touch free functions.
customer_reviews.author: ChicLady

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: So far, I am very happy about this purchase. I had to replace my iLuvs because they were just way too glitchy. You probably need some smaller tips if you have little ears like me. The talking part is good and there has been no problems with connectivity, the music part is great and if you put them on correctly you can shut out practically all background noise
customer_reviews.author: Lodona

customer_reviews.title: Great deal but super heavy
customer_reviews.text: I found a lot right with these wireless earbuds. The set up was easy. The battery life was satisfactory and the sound was decent considering the price of the earbuds. But the one thing i couldn't handle was the weight. They were so heavy they made my ears sore. I tried to get used to them but i just couldn't. I finally had to return them.
customer_reviews.author: bet

customer_reviews.title: Great value!
customer_reviews.text: Pros Great for calls, podcasts, video or audiobooks Charge lasts a good five hours Controls are pretty sweet Price is great value! Cons No charing buds while charging case Range of audio is low to mid compared to cheap wired headsets - not great for music The ergo of the fit is good, just a bit odd and takes getting used to
customer_reviews.author: QAtester

customer_reviews.title: Broke after less than 2 months
customer_reviews.text: I had these earbuds for less than 2 months before they stopped working completely, about a month in they would only work when plugged into an outlet and the battery would die quickly, then they just completely stopped working. When plugged into an outlet the light turns red and then green but the earbuds no longer connect or make any noise. Please send replacement, I know they were only $30 earbuds but I would expect them to last longer than 2 months :(
customer_reviews.author: Marlon Patterson

customer_reviews.title: They were great when they both worked.
customer_reviews.text: I've had them less then a week and the right earbud just stopped working it still connects but no audio and I know it's the headphones because I have a few different sets and they all work fine.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas Olary

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I always have a problem with wireless earbuds falling out of my ears. They either too big or too small. This one fits my right ear fine, but tends to not sit right in my left ear. That is not a problem with these earbuds, but my ears! The sound is good and price is reasonable. No sense spending hundreds of dollars when I only use while working out. I recommend!
customer_reviews.author: cpcjr

customer_reviews.title: A good pair of ear buds
customer_reviews.text: I have bought so many ear buds and I think I found a good pair. The only problem I have is that occasionally they start to cut out while playing my music. I have to put them back into the case to correct this. Not a problem except that my case is usually 1/2 mile away. (I work outside.) Other than that, quite please.
customer_reviews.author: Denise G.

customer_reviews.title: Great headphones. From an OG JLAB fan
customer_reviews.text: I’ve owned Numerous pairs of jlab headphones ever since they started out as a small manufacturer in Arizona. The sound quality is great and the price is right as I expected from JLab products. However after a couple months of owning I dropped the case with the headphones and one of them developed a short where the audio cuts in and out intermittently. I’m buying another set since they were outside the return window
customer_reviews.author: mickeycrack18

customer_reviews.title: A truly great purchase
customer_reviews.text: These wireless headphones are amazing for listening to pretty much anything on you phone or tablet. The only reason they don't get 5 stars from me is because when on the phone the other person can hear everything on my end. But then again, I bought them to be headphones, not a bluetooth head set. Also, they are water resistant, I've showered with them on and there have been no problems with them so far.
customer_reviews.author: Katia Vega

customer_reviews.title: Decent Headphones for the price
customer_reviews.text: I will have to say, I have purchased quite a few cheap wireless headphones. A lot of the time you find cheap feeling products in this price point. However the build quality for the headphones and case seems nice. Battery life lasts a long time, and the case has a built in charger. The audio quality is interesting, they are 3 different EQs but I just leave it on the signature EQ. The sound quality is on the better end of the cheap headphones. These are worth the $30 dollars.
customer_reviews.author: Payton

customer_reviews.title: Good for the money.
customer_reviews.text: The sound is good, they could be louder, but the sound is solid. The noise canceling is pretty much absolute, but that kinda makes them bad for wearing anywhere public. They completely negate the ability to maintain situational and environmental awareness. The fit is pretty comfortable, they seem to stay in place well.
customer_reviews.author: Andy668

customer_reviews.title: I can't believe these are so good for the price!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these after seeing a review online and decided since the rest of the household has Bluetooth headphones, why not get some myself? I was pleasantly surprised with the quality of the full range and although the volume is not over the top, I find them perfect with both in for music and only one in for podcasts and calls. Mic quality seems great because no one has had an issue hearing me while making calls. the charging case is a major plus and the magnets are very strong so no worries losing them.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Zalenski

customer_reviews.title: Probably the best wireless buds I've ever owned.
customer_reviews.text: These rock for the money. The magnetic charging dock is very good. The battery life is good and because each bud is self-contained I can use one bud at a time while the other is charging. I still have to figure out the equalizer and have been using it on evenly split. So far so good. Very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Steven H

customer_reviews.title: Great price and good product
customer_reviews.text: As a cyclist I was looking for an inexpensive wireless ear bud and I found it!!!!! It works great and the battery charge is about 5 hours. I only use 1 ear bud while riding and it works well. If I ride more than 5 hours I just bring the other one and use it in the other ear once the other ear bud runs out of battery. I have used both at the same time and the sound is really good, it really is a nice ear bud! I would recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Randall G. Edmondson

customer_reviews.title: surprisingly powerful
customer_reviews.text: I like the fact that my head is free of the headset that I was wearing before i rcvd these earbuds. The sound quality is perfect for my walks in the early morning. Living in the Arizona desert and doing outdoor exercising is uncomfortable enough with wearing a headset. Now my head is sweat free and cooler.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great ear bud, durable, clear!
customer_reviews.text: Great for the purpose I bought them for, the bass isn't as nice or deep as others in this range, but they are durable. I do a lot of audio books and podcasts and these stay put on hikes and rides, it AZ, so all year activities, in the heat you get the same ear sweat with others, these hold up!
customer_reviews.author: K. Morris

customer_reviews.title: Awesome....INSIDE OF RETURN WINDOW
customer_reviews.text: Everything was pretty good for the price but right outside of the return window, the earbuds started to stay in when cradled in the case. Usually you can keep bluetooth connected and put them in the cradle to stop them but now you must completely disconnect from bluetooth. BS and needs to be fixed going forward! Sound is good, battery lasts long(for me). Fix the bs malfunctions with metal connectors
customer_reviews.author: James Parker

customer_reviews.title: good for music not so much for calls
customer_reviews.text: I used to have the air buds till my doggo felt like eating them, tried these out in case my dog wanted to munch on these it wouldn't hurt so bad. Well they are ok for listening to music and such but poor mic quality makes it unusable for what i want them for. But these are good for people who only want to use them for music and not calls
customer_reviews.author: Brenda Deranger

customer_reviews.title: Would return if I could...
customer_reviews.text: Would return if return window had not already closed. Poor battery life gets me thru 1/3 to 1/2 a day, not loud enough to hear everything when I am walking outside fir an hour every day and they sometimes cut out & have trouble connecting. Also cannot be connected to more than one device at a time. Lame.
customer_reviews.author: Mark King

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: They seem to fit good, but the volume was always low no matter how much i turn my phone up. The equalizer was hard to use. And no matter where i stand people sound like robits or i am not able to hear them at all. The ear bud will go from off and disconnecting to power on and connecting all in a 2 sec period for no reason it just cuts off and on. Yes! i fully charged them before first time use.
customer_reviews.author: B Hard

customer_reviews.title: Very good earbuds
customer_reviews.text: It took me a few attempts to properly fit those in my ear, but once I figured it out, they would stay in place during the entire length of my runs. The sound is of good quality. The charger box has a nice design too, which I find both cool and convenient. I definitely recommend those earbuds.
customer_reviews.author: alcfeoh

customer_reviews.title: Good value for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Priceless good shift real fast. This is the second pair that I have bought. The design and quality seems to be much cheaper on this version than the one I purchased a year ago. There is only one size of rubber earpieces with this application. I would like the volume to be louder.
customer_reviews.author: Pete L

customer_reviews.title: Assembled / Made in China !?
customer_reviews.text: Assembled in China? I thought this was an all American item. What sell outs to save a buck.
customer_reviews.author: Deo

customer_reviews.title: Buy if you like 2 second listening intervals
customer_reviews.text: First day I had these they were rad, worked great, stellar battery life, comfy and a nice charging case. Second day, fully charged about an hour into listening the sound started cutting every 2 seconds. Updated and reset my phone thinking it was the Bluetooth, unpaired and paired again multiple times all to no avail. I bought these for 10hr work days, now I can’t even make it through the morning without having to throw them back on the charger. I’d save your money.
customer_reviews.author: Norty j

customer_reviews.title: Very Good Pair
customer_reviews.text: I’m giving this 4 stars rather than 5 for one reason only. I have odd ear holes. It sounds weird but even the smallest earbud doesnt quite fit correctly. They stay in if I move a minimal amount so it’s perfect for my intended use of road trips. Easy to connect with great sound quality. A nice snug fit (mostly) and overall great for the price. A very good pair of truly wireless earbuds.
customer_reviews.author: Mathew

customer_reviews.title: Sent back after one use
customer_reviews.text: Had a previous set of JLab wired earbuds and liked them. These were a disappointment and are headed back to Amazon. They fit fine. Secure even while running. However, they would not stay connected, even though the phone was less than 18 inches away on my arm. During the time they were connected they distorted the music and speaking horribly. I wanted to like them, but I guess I'll keep searching.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron H.

customer_reviews.title: DISAPPOINTMENT! Great while it lasted...
customer_reviews.text: Everything was fine for the first uses which totaled to 5 hours of listening to music, which was ten 30 min sessions walking on the treadmill. After that for some reason the left ear bud doesn't play music. I troubleshooted by turning off multiple times and pressing the buds 7X (as per their website recommendation) nothing worked. Summary: It was great until it wasn't
customer_reviews.author: Alanna

product_meta.title: JLab Audio Go Air True Wireless Bluetooth Earbuds + Charging Case | Black | Dual Connect | IP44 Sweat Resistance | Bluetooth 5.0 Connection | 3 EQ Sound Settings: JLab Signature, Balanced, Bass Boost
feature_bullets: LONG BATTERY LIFE: Listen for the long battery life; stay for the comfort. GO Air features 5 hours of playtime in each earbud and 15+ extra hours from the charging case. That’s 20+ hours of playtime. Recharge hassle-free with the charging case and integrated charging cable.

DUAL CONNECT: Use either earbud independently or use both and experience a seamless connection no matter the situation. Both earbuds auto connect to your device, so no need to worry about switching or missing a connection. A built-in MEMS microphone in each bud ensures clear calls.

SMALLER DESIGN: Go Air are 20% smaller than the JBuds Air. This means a slimmer profile, great for smaller ears. A longer earbud stem provides a more snug in-ear fit, creating a perfect seal for crystal clear sound. Pocket friendly case features an integrated charging cable for on-the-GO.

CUSTOM EQ3 SOUND: Featuring 8mm neodymium drivers, GO Air provides a crystal clear sound. With the optimal fit – try all three gel tip sizes to achieve a secure in-ear seal – you’ll enjoy amazing sound for all your tunes, calls and more. With just a tap or two via touch sensors, you can choose the sound to match your personal preference between: JLab Signature, Balanced and Bass Boost modes – without an app.
INCLUDES: GO Air Earbuds, Charging Case with Integrated Charging Cable, 3 Sets Gel Tips: Small, Medium, Large, JLab Two Year Warranty.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.1 out of 5 stars3,120 ratings4.1 out of 5 stars
